reviewText: Nothing wrong with the movie.  But it took a really long time to arrive from a not so good Amazon partner.

First is Gross Point Blank.  Nothing more attractive than a man that can kick ass whilst being a tortured soul....what could possibly be more appealing?  (Hugh Jackman as Wolverine..  possibly).  Anyway, very funny, dark, and, of course, the 80s references that I, oh ma gah, love.
High Fidelity is one of my favorite movies (the book is great too).  I think, Jack Black's best performance.  And the movie touches on some of my own themes, music and critical snobbery without actually having talent yourself.  Again, very funny and relative. You can watch them over and over...I do.
Grosse Pointe Blank / High FidelityI never get tired of watching these movies. They look and sound great on a HDTV. And I enjoy his sister Joan's bit parts.

This IS widescreen, not the sloppy pan & scan. Especially with High Fidelity I would think you'd want to see everything the excellent director, Stephen Frears puts on the screen - a WIDE SCREEN. Also, High Fidelity is enhanced for 16x9 TVs.

The transfer is not 100% (the print used for Grosse Pointe Blank looks a touch worn - ocassional scratches), but the single version DVDs are none better.

This is a real bargain and a great double feature.
If you're thinking of replacing the 1998 non-Ana Buena Vista DVD of GPB (717951000408) with this one, don't - it's still not...
A couple of John's oldies, but goodies...drift onto "The Grifters" & "Midnight In The Garden Of Good & Evil" if you're so inclined!
great bundle pack to buy.
Great deal
I like it

it doesn't need a review. There is nothing in this sharp, smart, absurd piece of literature that needs to be fixed or explained it works so well. It is a celebration and a mockery of pop culture that has a consistently great impromptu feeling all the way through.

Grosse Point Blank-This quirky film was fabulous. I loved the dark humor throughout the movie and John Cusack is at his finest, along with Minnie Driver and Dan Akyrod.
High Fidelity-I was told by a guy friend that it's exactly how me think. The movie was off beat and funny. Jack Black is a hoot. Tim Robbins has me laughing with his hippie ponytail. John Cusack-spot on as usual. The DVD's were new.

I had the movie, "Grosse Pointe Blank", on my iPod for years and I could always dip into it when I needed a laugh. A hitman going thru a quarter-life crisis is funny in a black way. John Cusack and Dan Ackroyd are hilarious!
Two great plots in one Package. John was at his best, outside of "The Grifters" which you should also own!
2 movies for the price of 1. Great deal. I'm a long time Fan of his movies and this was a great addition to my movie collection.
This is a favorite movie of my daughter's boyfriend.  I ordered it as a Christmas gift his first year with the family.  He was very pleased.  However, I have not seen the movie myself.

I recently purchased this two-movies-in-one-package deal because I can't believe how inexpensive DVDs are becoming in the age of instant digital media (right now, not ALL movies are available on demand so I'd rather purchase these two inexpensive flicks for one low price). It's amazing. I'm not much a collector of movies but I do own some flicks that I love watching time and again.

My biggest concern was whether these two movies on DVD were true Widescreen and would play correctly on my TV. Many of the reviews here reviewed the movie but not much on the product, that is the DVD itself. High Fidelity worked great on my 1080P HD TV. No problem there. However, the Grosse Point Blank DVD, I had to select a different picture size on the television in order for it to play "normally" that is the image isn't stretched out one way or another. If I played the Grosse Point Blank DVD on an analog TV I think it would play just fine and appear like a true widescreen/letterbox format. I've had this problem before with some of my exercise DVDs.

For me it's no big deal, even though I wish I didn't have to change the settings on my TV. Aside from this little hiccup, the picture quality is great, the sound is great, the discs were spotless, service was excellent. I don't know what else to say except that High Fidelity plays great on modern HDTVs and Grosse Point Blank didn't quite exactly. It is widescreen but you see that on an analog TV, if this makes any sense.
GOT IT FOR ONE OF THE MOVIES THE OTHER WAS A BONUS. WATCHED THEM BOTH SEVERAL TIMES ALREADY, AND WILL WATCH AGAIN.

Top 5 Movies of all time:

10 Things I Hate About You
High Fidelity
Hercules (The Cartoon)

Johnny is my all time favorite. And come on, Minnie? Both of their best film roles ever.
If you find yourself constantly ranking things, and you love hitmen, then buy it! I've seen them a million times, and I laugh the whole way through every time.

i have always enjoyed John Cusack's work and the presence of Minnie Driver and Jack Black does not hurt either.

An excellent pairing of Grosse Pointe Blank and High Fidelity. Both films have John Cusack as a self-made entrepreneur - professional killer in GPB and indy record store owner in HF. He struggles with love and morality in both films and in the end, works through his inner conflicts and gets the girl.

A highly recommended DVD

If you have not watched either of these films then you really are missing out.

Get them, watch them and love them.

These are the films you go back to every once in a while and still enjoy.

I liked this movie, although I think it was very much to the period (I watched this movie in July 2011 in my early 20's. The movie came out in 1997). A lot of the conventions and humor did not resonate as well with me as I had hoped. I loved the story and am a Huge Piven fan. I thought he was used well. I also thought Cusack was good pick for the role. The genre is weird...it is like a drama-comedy, much more common today I feel. I did think the movie needed some cutting. It was a bit long, but I liked the overall idea. I think with some cutting, some rewrites and reshotting today the movie could be a monster comedy hit.(which I may chalk up the movie not playing as well years after it came out as the genre has been developed more) In the end, if you a movie person I would recommend it. This Original Idea is refreshing amongst an movie scene of mostly stupid or unoriginal ideas. A remake of this movie with a Wedding Crashers (Rated),Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy [Blu-ray] or Superbad feel behind it could be a monster comedic/dramatic hit in my eyes. If you are looking for something different, like any of the cast or original stories, ideas, jokes or dialogue this movie is for you. Packaging note: The Discs come as two separate discs, and I bought the pack because this was cheaper than just buying Grosse Pointe Blank at the time.

To put it simple, these are two very original and smart comedies.  If you're a John Cusak fan, or even if you're just a fan of comedy, don't even think about it...definitely pick this product up!  These films are 100% worth the money.
I love this movie.  It has a fantastic amount of gore....but it is done in such a way as to not be offensive.  Does that sound impossible?  But it isn't.  It is a fun movie.

Re: Grosse Pointe Blank -- This is what I always watch instead of attending any of my high school reunions.
Catch Phrase: "Ten years. TEN Years? TEN YEARS???" (Jeremy Piven rocks.)

Re: High Fidelity -- Growing out of selfishness into learning how to love another and maybe, just maybe, have a chance at happiness.
Catch Phrase: "If you really wanted to mess me up, you needed to get to me sooner!"
